intro: Bonnetia anceps var. typica, commonly known as the Hawaiian bonnetia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal and lowland areas. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers, which are often visited by native insects. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly hairy texture. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of Hawaii.
